00020 /**
00021  * @file   TsvFile.h
00022  * @brief  Headers for the TsvFile classes.
00023  *         Read @link file-format-tsv the TsvFile format @endlink for an overview.
00024  */

00062   /// line numbers cant be negative
00063   typedef uint32_t linenum_t;
00064 
00065   const int TSV_INTERNSIZE_UNSET=-1;
00066 
00067   /// Selector for what is used to link the binding
00068   enum bindto_t {
00069     TSV_BINDTO_NONE  = 0, ///< The binding wont be bound
00070     TSV_BINDTO_CIDX  = 1, ///< Bound to column indexed by number
00071     TSV_BINDTO_CNAME = 2, ///< Bound to a column index by name
00072   };
00073 
00074   enum valstate_t {
00075     VALSTATE_NONE=0,
00076     VALSTATE_INT=1,
00077     VALSTATE_DOUBLE=2,
00078     VALSTATE_STRING=3,
00079   };
00080 
00081   enum tsv_type_t {
00082     TSV_TYPE_UNKNOWN = 0,
00083     TSV_TYPE_ERR     = 1,
00084     TSV_TYPE_STRING  = 2,
00085     TSV_TYPE_INT     = 3,
00086     TSV_TYPE_FLOAT   = 4,
00087     TSV_TYPE_DOUBLE  = 5,
00088   };
00089 
00090   /// Return values to signal Error codes
00091   enum tsv_return_t {
00092     TSV_OK                   =  -1, ///< No Error
00093     TSV_LINE_BLANK           =  -2, ///< The line is blank          (m_lineLvl)
00094     TSV_LINE_COMMENT         =  -3, ///< The line is a comment line (m_lineLvl)
00095     TSV_ERR_UNKNOWN          = -11, ///< An otherwise unknown error
00096     TSV_ERR_NOTFOUND         = -12, ///< The value was not found
00097     TSV_ERR_NULL             = -13, ///< The value was null
00098     TSV_ERR_CONVERSION       = -14, ///< The value could not be converted
00099     TSV_ERR_FILEIO           = -15, ///< Some sort of file IO error
00100     TSV_ERR_FORMAT           = -16, ///< The format of the file is bad
00101     TSV_ERR_EOF              = -17, ///< Hit the end of the file
00102     //
00103     TSV_HEADER               = -30, ///< A header line was read
00104     TSV_HEADER_LAST          = -31, ///< Did not read a header line
00105     TSV_LEVEL_LAST           = -32, ///< Did not read a line of the correct level
00106     TSV_FIND_LAST            = -33, ///< Found the last matching value
00107     //
00108     TSV_ERR_BINARY           = -40, ///< This is some sort of binary file.
00109     TSV_ERR_CALVIN           = -41, ///< This is a calvin file.
00110     TSV_ERR_HDF5             = -42, ///< This is a HDF5 file.
00111     //
00112     TSV_LASTVALUE            = -99, ///< end of errors
00113   };
00114 
00115   /// Flags supplied to when finding matches
00116   enum tsv_op_t {
00117     TSV_OP_LT     = 0x01,
00118     TSV_OP_LTEQ   = 0x03,
00119     TSV_OP_EQ     = 0x02,
00120     TSV_OP_GTEQ   = 0x06,
00121     TSV_OP_GT     = 0x04,
00122   };
00123 
00124   /// The datatype of a index
00125   enum tsv_indexkind_t {
00126     TSV_INDEX_STRING = 0x1,
00127     TSV_INDEX_INT    = 0x2,
00128     TSV_INDEX_DOUBLE = 0x3,
00129     TSV_INDEX_UINT   = 0x4,
00130     TSV_INDEX_ULONGLONG   = 0x5
00131   };
00132   /// Should the results be ordered by the line nubmer or value
00133   enum tsv_orderby_t {
00134     TSV_ORDERBY_LINE = 0x01,
00135     TSV_ORDERBY_VAL  = 0x02
00136   };
00137   /// The format of the file.
00138   enum tsv_fileformat_t {
00139     TSV_FORMAT_NONE  = 0x00,
00140     TSV_FORMAT_V1    = 0x01,
00141     TSV_FORMAT_V2    = 0x02,
00142     TSV_FORMAT_TABLE = 0x03,
00143     TSV_FORMAT_BAD   = 0xff
00144   };
00145   /// Requirements for binding.
00146   enum tsv_bindopt_t {
00147     TSV_BIND_OPTIONAL = 0x01, /// bind if present
00148     TSV_BIND_WARNING  = 0x02, /// warn if not bound
00149     TSV_BIND_REQUIRED = 0x04, /// error if not bound
00150     TSV_BIND_NOFLAG   = 0x00  /// nothing
00151   };
00152   /// Flags for querying headers
00153   enum tsv_addflag_t {
00154     TSV_ADD_NONE     = 0x00, /// just for nothing...
00155     TSV_ADD_KEYS     = 0x01, /// return keys
00156     TSV_ADD_COMMENTS = 0x02, /// return comments
00157     TSV_ADD_ALL      = (TSV_ADD_KEYS|TSV_ADD_COMMENTS) /// keys and comments
00158   };
00159   /// misc optional flags
00160   enum tsv_optionflag_t {
00161     TSV_OPT_NONE           = 0x00,
00162     TSV_OPT_CASESENSTIVE   = 0x01,
00163     TSV_OPT_CASEINSENSTIVE = 0x02,
00164   };
00165 
00166   // string functions
00167   void ltrim(std::string& str);
00168   void rtrim(std::string& str);
00169   void trim(std::string& str);
00170   //
00171   std::string tolower(const std::string& str);
00172   //
00173   void dequote(std::string& str);
00174   int  splitstr(const std::string& str,char c,std::vector<std::string>& vec);
00175   int  countchars(const std::string& str,char c);
00176   //
00177   int unescapeChar(int c);
00178   int escapeChar(int c);
00179   std::string escapeString(const std::string& str,const char escapeChar);
00180   //
00181   bool header_ptr_less(const affx::TsvFileHeaderLine* a,const affx::TsvFileHeaderLine* b);
00182 };

00188 /// TsvFileBinding records the binding of a Column to a field.
00189 /// When "tsv->bind()" is called, a TsvFileBinding is created to record
00190 /// The details of the binding.  When a file is opened, the bindings are
00191 /// linked to the correct Columns.
00192 class affx::TsvFileBinding {
00193 public:
00194   int            m_bindto_clvl;   ///< The column level
00195   affx::bindto_t m_bindto_type;   ///< Is is bound by index or name?
00196   int            m_bindto_cidx;   ///< The index of the bound column
00197   std::string    m_bindto_cname;  ///< The name of the bound column
00198   tsv_bindopt_t  m_flags;         ///< What options are flagged?
00199 
00200   int            m_interncache_size; ///< How many strings should be interned (reuse the storage)
00201   bool islinked;                  ///< Is this linked to a column?
00202 
00203   /// Only one of these should be set.
00204   /// The value of the column will be stored whereever they point.
00205   std::string* m_ptr_string;      ///< pointer to std::string
00206   int*         m_ptr_int;         ///< pointer to int
00207   double*      m_ptr_double;      ///< pointer to double
00208   float*       m_ptr_float;       ///< pointer to float
00209   unsigned int*  m_ptr_uint;      ///< pointer to unsigned int
00210   uint64_t*    m_ptr_ulonglong;   ///< pointer to unsigned long long
00211 
00212   //
00213   TsvFileBinding();
00214   ~TsvFileBinding();
00215   //
00216   void clear();
00217   std::string get_type_str();
00218 };
00219

00223 /// TsvFileField holds the data read from a column.
00224 /// The data is read into a std::string buffer.
00225 /// Rather than resizing the buffer all the time, we try and
00226 /// fill it "in place". Most of the time the new value should be the same
00227 /// size as the old value.
00228 /// We store the clvl and cidx info in the Column as well.
00229 /// Saves having to search for it in the TsvFile object.
00230 ///
00231 /// "cidx" is counted from *after* the leading tabs.
00232 ///
00233 
00234 class affx::TsvFileField {
00235 public:
00236   int         m_clvl;             ///< The indent level of the column
00237   int         m_cidx;             ///< The column number of the column.
00238   std::string m_cname;            ///< Column name. (Could be blank)
00239   tsv_type_t  m_ctype;
00240   bool m_optAutoDequote;          ///< Automatically strip quotes?
00241   bool m_optAutoTrim;             ///< Automatically strip white space?
00242   std::string m_buffer;           ///< Buffer space
00243 
00244   // copies of string for reuse
00245   int m_interncache_size;
00246   std::vector<std::string> m_interncache_vec;
00247 
00248   int m_precision;                ///< the output precision
00249 
00250   ////
00251   int m_max_size;
00252 
00253   //
00254   bool m_isnull;           ///< True if null
00255   bool m_ignore;           ///< If this column should be ignored
00256 
00257   int m_val_state;
00258 
00259   //// Cached "int" conversions.  Once converted we dont need to do it again
00260   int    m_value_int;             ///< The cached value
00261   bool   m_value_int_done;        ///< Has this value been converted?
00262   int    m_value_int_rv;          ///< The return value for the conversion
00263 
00264   /// Cached "double" conversions.
00265   double m_value_double;          ///< same as int
00266   bool   m_value_double_done;     ///< same as int
00267   int    m_value_double_rv;       ///< same as int
00268 
00269   /// Cached "unsigned int" conversions.
00270   unsigned int m_value_uint;      ///< same as int
00271   bool   m_value_uint_done;       ///< same as int
00272   int    m_value_uint_rv;         ///< same as int
00273 
00274   /// Cached "uint64_t" conversions.
00275   uint64_t m_value_ulonglong;     ///< same as int
00276   bool   m_value_ulonglong_done;  ///< same as int
00277   int    m_value_ulonglong_rv;    ///< same as int
00278 
00279   std::vector<affx::TsvFileBinding*> m_linkedvar_vec; ///< Linked bindings
00280 
00281   //
00282   TsvFileField();
00283   ~TsvFileField();
00284 
00285   //
00286   void init();
00287   void clear();
00288   bool isNull();
00289   bool isEmpty();
00290 
00291   //
00292   int setBuffer(const std::string& str);
00293   int setPrecision(int places);
00294   //int setInternCacheSize(int size);
00295   void convertToString();
00296 
00297   std::string get_name();
00298   affx::tsv_type_t get_type();
00299   int get_max_size();
00300   affx::tsv_type_t set_type(affx::tsv_type_t ctype);
00301 
00302   // get the value of the column
00303   int get(std::string*  val);
00304   int get(short*        val);
00305   int get(int*          val);
00306   int get(double*       val);
00307   int get(float*        val);
00308   int get(unsigned int* val);
00309   int get(uint64_t*     val);
00310   //
00311 #ifndef SWIG
00312   int get(std::vector<int>* val,char sep=',');
00313   int get(std::vector<float>* val,char sep=',');
00314   int get(std::vector<double>* val,char sep=',');
00315   int get(std::vector<std::string>* val,char sep=',');
00316 #endif
00317 
00318   //
00319   int set(const std::string& val); ///< set the val
00320   int set(int           val); ///< set the val
00321   int set(short         val); ///< set the val
00322   int set(double        val); ///< set the val
00323   int set(unsigned int  val); ///< set the val
00324   int set(uint64_t      val); ///< set the val
00325 
00326 #ifndef SWIG
00327   int set(float         val); ///< set the val
00328 #endif
00329   //
00330 #ifndef SWIG
00331   int set(const std::vector<std::string>& val,char sep=',');
00332   int set(const std::vector<int>& val,char sep=',');
00333   int set(const std::vector<float>& val,char sep=',');
00334   int set(const std::vector<double>& val,char sep=',');
00335 #endif
00336 
00337   ///
00338   void linkedvars_assign(affx::TsvFile* tsvfile);

00340   void linkedvars_clear();
00341   //
00342   std::string get_bound_types_str();
00343 };

00347 /// @brief TsvFileIndex maps values to line positions
00348 class affx::TsvFileIndex {
00349 public:
00350   /// Maybe we should inherit
00351   int            m_bindto_clvl;   ///< The column level
00352   affx::bindto_t m_bindto_type;   ///< Is is bound by index or name?
00353   int            m_bindto_cidx;   ///< The index of the bound column
00354   std::string    m_bindto_cname;  ///< The name of the bound column
00355 
00356   int  m_kind;   ///< The datatype being indexed (string,int,double)
00357   int  m_flags;  ///< flags for the index (unused)
00358   bool m_done;   ///< has the index been populated?
00359 
00360   // @todo Change this to something denser
00361   std::multimap<std::string,linenum_t> m_index_str2line;    ///< map of string value to lines
00362   std::multimap<int        ,linenum_t> m_index_int2line;    ///< map of int values to lines
00363   std::multimap<double     ,linenum_t> m_index_double2line; ///< map of double values to lines
00364   std::multimap<unsigned int,linenum_t> m_index_uint2line;     ///< map of unsigned int values to lines
00365   std::multimap<uint64_t   ,linenum_t> m_index_ulonglong2line; ///< map of uint64_t values to lines
00366 
00367   //
00368   TsvFileIndex();
00369   ~TsvFileIndex();
00370 
00371   //
00372   void init();
00373   void clear();
00374   void data_add(TsvFileField* field,linenum_t line);
00375   //
00376   int results_append(std::vector<linenum_t>& results,int op,std::string val);
00377   int results_append(std::vector<linenum_t>& results,int op,int         val);
00378   int results_append(std::vector<linenum_t>& results,int op,double      val);
00379   int results_append(std::vector<linenum_t>& results,int op,unsigned int val);
00380   int results_append(std::vector<linenum_t>& results,int op,uint64_t    val);
00381   //
00382   void dump();
00383 
00384   // Templates are private to prevent accidental use.
00385 private:
00386   template <typename T1, typename linenum_t> int results_append_tmpl(std::vector<linenum_t>& results,std::multimap<T1,linenum_t>& map,int op,T1& val);
00387   template<typename T1, typename linenum_t> void dump_map(std::multimap<T1,linenum_t>& map);
00388 };

00415 /// \brief A class for reading and writing Tab Seperated Value (TSV) files.
00416 ///        See \link file-format-tsv the TsvFile format document \endlink
00417 ///        and the example program \link tsv-example.cpp tsv-example.cpp \endlink .
00418 class affx::TsvFile {
00419   //
00420   typedef TsvFileHeaderLine header_t;
00421   typedef std::multimap<std::string,header_t*>::iterator header_iter_t;
00422 
00423 public:
00424   /// Options which can be set.
00425   bool m_optAllowDataComment;   ///< allow comments mixed in with data?
00426   bool m_optAbortOnError;       ///< ?
00427   bool m_optAutoColumns;        ///< add more columns as needed.
00428   bool m_optAutoDequote;        ///< remove quotes when reading?
00429   bool m_optAutoIndex;          ///< ?
00430   bool m_optAutoSenseSep;       ///< Autosense between tabs and commas
00431   bool m_optAutoTrim;           ///< remove whitespace from value?
00432   bool m_optCheckFormatOnOpen;  ///< Automatically check for binary files?
00433   bool m_optDoQuote;            ///< Put quotes on output?
00434   char m_optEscapeChar;         ///< the escape char to use
00435   bool m_optEscapeOk;           ///< Obey the escapechar?
00436   bool m_optHasColumnHeader;    ///< read the first line as column headers?
00437   bool m_optThrowOnError;       ///< ?
00438 
00439   unsigned char m_optQuoteChar; ///< Quote char to use
00440   std::string m_optEndl;        ///< End of line sequence to use
00441   unsigned char m_optFieldSep;  ///< Field seperator defaults to TAB.
00442   bool m_optHdrDblQuoteComma;   ///< Header contains '","'.
00443   bool m_optLinkVarsOnOpen;     ///< Link variables when calling open()
00444   //
00445   char m_optQuoteChar1;         ///< Quoting Character
00446   char m_optQuoteChar2;         ///< Quoting Character
00447   //
00448   int m_optPrecision;           ///< Default Precision
00449 
00450   int m_errno;         ///< The error number
00451   bool m_eof;          ///< at eof?
00452   int  m_fileFormat;   ///< What version of file was read?
00453 
00454   /// The filename being visited
00455   std::string  m_fileName;
00456 
00457   /// Where the data begins (line 0)
00458   std::fstream::pos_type m_fileDataPos;
00459 
00460   /// Tag name of column header
00461   std::string m_headName;
00462 
00463 private:
00464 
00465   bool m_rawOpen;
00466   
00467   // marked private to force use of the accessors.
00468   int m_lineNum; ///< The current line number
00469   int m_lineLvl; ///< The level of the current line
00470 
00471   // A handle for IO operations
00472   std::fstream m_fileStream;
00473 
00474   //public:
00475   std::fstream::pos_type m_line_fpos; ///< Where the current line starts
00476 
00477   //private:
00478   ///
00479   std::vector<header_t*> m_headers_vec;
00480   bool m_headers_vec_packed;
00481   // where we are in the vector
00482   int m_headers_idx;
00483   header_t* m_headers_curptr;
00484   /// the key=val headers in string form.
00485   std::multimap<std::string,header_t*>  m_headers_bykey;
00486   /// used for headersNext
00487   header_iter_t m_headers_iter;
00488   std::string m_headers_curkey_string;
00489 
00490   /// The columns by column level and column index
00491   std::vector<std::vector<affx::TsvFileField> > m_column_map;
00492   /// Map the columns names to column indexes
00493   std::vector<std::map<std::string,int> > m_cnametocidx_map;
00494 
00495   /// The state of the bound and linked vars...
00496   bool m_linkvars_done;     ///< Are the links up to date
00497   int  m_linkvars_errors;   ///< Count of link errors
00498   int  m_linkvars_warnings; ///< Count of link warnings
00499   std::vector<TsvFileBinding*> m_linkvars_vec; ///< Vector of bindings linked to us
00500 
00501   /// Have the indexing been done?
00502   bool m_index_done;
00503   /// A map of line numbers to file postions
00504   std::vector<unsigned int> m_index_linefpos;
00505   /// A map of line numbers by level so we can find the parent lines
00506   std::vector<std::vector<unsigned int> > m_index_lineclvl;
00507 
00508   /// A vector of indexes which are defined.
00509   std::vector<TsvFileIndex*> m_index_vec;
00510   /// A vector of lines which match the last "findBegin"
00511   std::vector<unsigned int> m_findresults;
00512   /// The postition we are at in the returned results
00513   std::vector<unsigned int>::size_type m_findresults_pos;
00514 
00515 public:
00516   //
00517   TsvFile();
00518   TsvFile(const std::string& fname);
00519   ~TsvFile();
00520

00523

00528 #endif
